intro: Sonchus glaucus, commonly known as blue sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, hairy leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with a rosette of basal leaves that are blue-green in color. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, followed by small, spiky achenes. Sonchus glaucus is often found in disturbed soils and can be considered an invasive species in some regions.
